com.github.jochenw.afw.core.util

Class Streams

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jochenw.afw.core.util.Streams

  • public class Streams
extends Object
    Utility class for working with Exceptions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void copy(InputStream pIn, OutputStream pOut)
      Copies the contents of the given InputStream to the given OutputStream, using a buffer of 8192 bytes.
      static void copy(InputStream pIn, OutputStream pOut, int pBufSize)
      Copies the contents of the given InputStream to the given OutputStream, using a buffer of pBufSize bytes.
      static void copy(Reader pIn, Writer pOut)
      Copies the contents of the given Reader to the given Writer, using a buffer of 8192 characters.
      static void copy(Reader pIn, Writer pOut, int pBufSize)
      Copies the contents of the given Reader to the given Writer, using a buffer of pBufSize characters.

      Returns the contents of the given InputStream, as a byte array.
      static String read(Reader pIn)
      Returns the contents of the given Reader, as a string.

      Returns an Reader, which returns the same contents than the given, but prevents the latter from being closed.

      Returns an OutputStream, which copies its output to the given, but prevents the latter from being closed.
      static Writer uncloseableWriter(Writer pOut)
      Returns a Writer, which copies its output to the given, but prevents the latter from being closed.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public static byte[] read(InputStream pIn)
        Returns the contents of the given InputStream, as a byte array. The InputStream is closed.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The InputStream to read from. Will be closed.
        Returns:
        The contents, which have been read from pIn.

      • copy

        public static void copy(InputStream pIn,
                        OutputStream pOut)
        Copies the contents of the given InputStream to the given OutputStream, using a buffer of 8192 bytes. Neither stream is closed. Equivalent to invoking copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, int) with a buffer size of 8192 bytes.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The InputStream to read from.
        pOut - The OutputStream to write to.
        See Also:
        copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, int), copy(java.io.Reader, java.io.Writer), copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, int)

      • copy

        public static void copy(InputStream pIn,
                        OutputStream pOut,
                        int pBufSize)
        Copies the contents of the given InputStream to the given OutputStream, using a buffer of pBufSize bytes. Neither stream is closed.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The InputStream to read from.
        pOut - The OutputStream to write to.
        pBufSize - The buffer size to use, in bytes (performance).
        See Also:
        copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream), copy(java.io.Reader, java.io.Writer), copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, int)

      • read

        public static String read(Reader pIn)
        Returns the contents of the given Reader, as a string. The Reader is closed.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The Reader to read from. This Reader is not closed, after invoking this method.
        Returns:
        The contents, which have been read from pIn.
        See Also:
        read(java.io.InputStream)

      • copy

        public static void copy(Reader pIn,
                        Writer pOut)
        Copies the contents of the given Reader to the given Writer, using a buffer of 8192 characters. Neither stream is closed. Equivalent to invoking copy(java.io.Reader, java.io.Writer, int) with a buffer size of 8192 characters.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The Reader to read from.
        pOut - The Writer to write to.
        See Also:
        copy(java.io.Reader, java.io.Writer, int), copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream), copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, int)

      • copy

        public static void copy(Reader pIn,
                        Writer pOut,
                        int pBufSize)
        Copies the contents of the given Reader to the given Writer, using a buffer of pBufSize characters. Neither stream is closed.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The Reader to read from.
        pOut - The Writer to write to.
        pBufSize - The buffer size to use.
        See Also:
        copy(Reader, Writer), copy(InputStream, OutputStream), copy(InputStream, OutputStream, int)

      • uncloseableStream

        public static InputStream uncloseableStream(InputStream pIn)
        _Returns an InputStream, which returns the same contents than the given, but prevents the latter from being closed.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The InputStream to read.
        Returns:
        Another InputStream, which is actually reading pIn, but cannot be closed. (The InputStream.close() method may be invoked, but it does nothing.)

      • uncloseableReader

        public static Reader uncloseableReader(Reader pIn)
        Returns an Reader, which returns the same contents than the given, but prevents the latter from being closed.
        Parameters:
        pIn - The Reader to read.
        Returns:
        Another Reader, which is actually reading pIn, but cannot be closed. (The Reader.close() method may be invoked, but it does nothing.)

      • uncloseableStream

        public static OutputStream uncloseableStream(OutputStream pOut)
        Returns an OutputStream, which copies its output to the given, but prevents the latter from being closed.
        Parameters:
        pOut - The OutputStream to write to.
        Returns:
        Another OutputStream, which copies all output to pOut, but cannot be closed. (The OutputStream.close() method may be invoked, but it does nothing.)

      • uncloseableWriter

        public static Writer uncloseableWriter(Writer pOut)
        Returns a Writer, which copies its output to the given, but prevents the latter from being closed.
        Parameters:
        pOut - The Writer to write to.
        Returns:
        Another Writer, which copies all output to pOut, but cannot be closed. (The Writer.close() method may be invoked, but it does nothing.)
